references: We also evaluate the performance of CHB for training a relatively small neural network with one hidden layer with 303030 nodes. For training the neural network, all algorithms are stopped after 500500500 iterations with the step size α=0.02𝛼0.02\alpha=0.02 while employing the regularization parameter λ=1/49990𝜆149990\lambda=1/49990. For CHB and censoring-based GD, we choose ε1=0.01subscript𝜀10.01\varepsilon_{1}=0.01. Compared to HB, GD, and censoring-based GD, Figure 5(c) and Figure 5(d) illustrate that CHB has competitive convergence performance for this nonconvex problem with the smallest number of communications. Table I summarizes the number of communications and iterations to attain a given objective error which indicates the desirable performance of CHB in terms of communication savings and convergence rate. For linear and lasso regression, CHB reduces the communications to less than half that needed for HB, and for logistic regression the communications are reduced by two orders of magnitude compared to HB. For the neural network training example, CHB and HB reduce the norm square of the gradient by an order of magnitude compared to censoring-based GD and GD, and CHB uses only 24%percent2424\% of the communications needed for HB. Additional numerical results on other real datasets and discussion of the impact of step size are given next.

references: To promote comparison, we first use the same real datasets with the same setup as [54]. Specifically, we consider linear regression with the Housing, Body fat, and Abalone datasets and logistic regression with the Ionosphere, Adult fat, and Derm datasets. We evenly split each dataset into three workers and employ the minimal number of features among all datasets as the number of features used in the test. Additionally, we also consider lasso regression with the Ionosphere, Adult fat, and Derm datasets. In all these regression tasks, we choose α=1/L𝛼1𝐿\alpha=1/L for all four algorithms. For CHB and censoring-based GD, we choose ε1=0.1/(α2​M2)subscript𝜀10.1superscript𝛼2superscript𝑀2\varepsilon_{1}=0.1/(\alpha^{2}M^{2}). For HB and CHB, we choose β=0.4𝛽0.4\beta=0.4. The values of the regularization parameter for logistic regression and lasso regression are λ=0.001𝜆0.001\lambda=0.001 and λ=0.1𝜆0.1\lambda=0.1, respectively. All regression tasks stop when the objective error is less than 10−7superscript10710^{-7}. Furthermore, we consider training a neural network with Adult fat dataset where we choose α=0.01𝛼0.01\alpha=0.01 for all algorithms. For CHB and censoring-based GD, we choose ε1=0.01subscript𝜀10.01\varepsilon_{1}=0.01. Again, for HB and CHB, we choose β=0.4𝛽0.4\beta=0.4. The regularization parameter we choose for the neural network is λ=1/1605𝜆11605\lambda=1/1605. The optimization process is stopped after 500500500 iterations for training the neural network. Figure 6 and Figure 7 indicate the effectiveness of CHB in terms of communication reduction for the four learning tasks considered in this paper. The specific results are summarized in Table II.

references: We next test the performance of CHB on a larger dataset MNIST [63]. In all regression tasks, we set ε1=0.1/(α2​M2)subscript𝜀10.1superscript𝛼2superscript𝑀2\varepsilon_{1}=0.1/(\alpha^{2}M^{2}) for CHB and censoring-based GD. For HB and CHB, we set β=0.4𝛽0.4\beta=0.4. The largest number of iterations for each algorithm in each regression task is fixed to be 200020002000. For linear regression and lasso regression, we set α=10−8𝛼superscript108\alpha=10^{-8}. For logistic regression, we use α=10−6𝛼superscript106\alpha=10^{-6}. The values of regularization parameter for lasso regression and logistic regression are λ=0.5𝜆0.5\lambda=0.5 and λ=0.001𝜆0.001\lambda=0.001, respectively. In training a neural network with the regularization parameter λ=1/60000𝜆160000\lambda=1/60000, we choose α=0.02𝛼0.02\alpha=0.02 for all algorithms. For CHB and censoring-based GD, we choose ε1=0.01subscript𝜀10.01\varepsilon_{1}=0.01. For HB and CHB, we choose the constant β=0.4𝛽0.4\beta=0.4. The largest number of iterations is set to be 500500500 in training a neural network. In Figure 8 and Figure 9, for the fixed total number of iterations, CHB shows a competitive communication saving performance while maintaining a relatively smaller objective error compared to GD and censoring-based GD. Specific results are summarized in Table III.
